title: 1 second studder every few mins or so - Help anyone?
body:
Alright so I'm decent with computers but I havent been able to solve this problem and its making me think its a hardware issue.

I'm on a laptop and I get 60+ fps and my ping is like 32 and I got great connection.... HOWEVER
every few mins or so my game stops for like a second and then is fine again. I havent seen any network problems no lag spike or packet loss or anything.

I checked temps and its a laptop so its hotter but its not throttling or being crazy or anything.

Also the problem is worse on windows 10. Anyone have any ideas? or something I can use to log my computer while its running and maybe notice something.

Edit: Also I've got newest drivers and I've tried older drivers and default drivers and every windows 10 fix. I have everything disabled that could cause problems and it still does it with basically safe mode on.

Also I've tried fresh installs of both windows 7 and windows 10. Both have the problem but windows 7 doesnt freeze up as long. Its more of a microstudder every min or two.


Thanks again guys.

replies.body:
Hmmm....this can actually be a bit tricky because it doesn't instantly narrow itself down to either a hardware issue or a network issue:  essentially, given your description it could honestly be either.  

The best step you can take when encountering issues like this is to start ruling out root causes so we can narrow it down.  Connection Issues are much more common, so I would like to rule those out first.  Make sure to head over to our [Connection Analyzer Tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743) and run it.  It will give you a general health check on your connection to League as well as some steps you can try if it found issues.

Reply back and let me know if this doesn't seem to help!

I tried what it said it didn't help. 

[img]https://s32.postimg.org/ha07y9hdx/Untitled.png[/img]
My connection is good. 90Mbps and I'm 2 1/2 hours from chicago.

So I had/have the same problem and sent a ticket to the riot support. The support recommended to deactivate IntelliPark which can cause those freezes/studders. I have also noticed that those freezes don't appear when the hard drive is not fragmented (minimizes the problems caused by IntelliPark)
Oh and I have a new solid state drive that I run everything off of.
I have been having similar problems, usually in the first 5 min of a game where everything will freeze for a second. Super annoying, but thankfully it hasn't caused me to throw any games yet.
honestly I don't know what would cause a problem on my end, i've been playing fine for 4 years and its been like this the past week or two
Im also having this problem, I thought maybe it was my computer so I lowered my graphics down to minimum settings, and my fps shot up to 90 but i still got the lag every few clicks

Same sort of thing is happening to me but more than every minute.  If i click my champion to walk back and forth he will stutter for whatever reason, so it makes it hard to get a rhythm last hitting as an adc.  I tried reinstalling league and nothing changed.
